read this it is so sad 
----- 
Subject: Fw: This will tear at your heartstrings


 
----- Original Message ----- 
From: Subject: This will tear at your heartstrings


Subject: Fw: a poem that gives you goosebumps

> 

> 

> 

> A drunk man in an Oldsmobile 

> 

> They said had run the light 

> 

> That caused the six-car pileup 

> 

> On 109 that night. 

> 

> When broken bodies lay about 

> 

> And blood was everywhere, 

> 

> The sirens screamed out eulogies, 

> 

> For death was in the air. 

> 

> A mother, trapped inside her car, 

> 

> Was heard above the noise; 

> 

> Her plaintive plea near split the air: 

> 

> "Oh, God, please spare my boys!" 

> 

> She fought to loose her pinned hands; 

> 

> She struggled to get free, 

> 

> But mangled metal held her fast 

> 

> In grim captivity. 

> 

> Her frightened eyes then focused 

> 

> On where the back seat once had been, 

> 

> But all she saw was broken glass and 

> 

> Two children's seats crushed in. 

> 

> Her twins were nowhere to be seen; 

> 

> She did not hear them cry, 

> 

> And then she prayed they'd been thrown free, 

> 

> "Oh, God, don't let them die!" 

> 

> Then firemen came and cut her loose, 

> 

> But when they searched the back, 

> 

> They found therein no little boys, 

> 

> But the seat belts were intact. 

> 

> They thought the woman had gone mad 

> 

> And was traveling alone, 

> 

> But when they turned to question her, 

> 

> They discovered she was gone. 

> 

> Policemen saw her running wild 

> 

> And screaming above the noise 

> 

> In beseeching supplication, 

> 

> "Please help me find my boys! 

> 

> They're four years old and wear blue shirts; 

> 

> Their jeans are blue to match." 

> 

> One cop spoke up, "They're in my car, 

> 

> And they don't have a scratch. 

> 

> They said their daddy put them there 

> 

> And gave them each a cone, 

> 

> Then told them both to wait for Mom 

> 

> To come and take them home. 

> 

> I've searched the area high and low, 

> 

> But I can't find their dad. 

> 

> He must have fled the scene, 

> 

> I guess, and that is very bad." 

> 

> The mother hugged the twins and said, 

> 

> While wiping at a tear, 

> 

> "He could not flee the scene, you see, 

> 

> For he's been dead a year." 

> 

> The cop just looked confused and asked, 

> 

> "Now, how can that be true?" 

> 

> The boys said, "Mommy, Daddy came 

> 

> and left a kiss for you." 

> 

> He told us not to worry 

> 

> And that you would be all right, 

> 

> And then he put us in this car with 

> 

> The pretty, flashing light. 

> 

> We wanted him to stay with us, 

> 

> Because we miss him so, 

> 

> But Mommy, he just hugged us tight 

> 

> And said he had to go. 

> 

> He said someday we'd understand 

> 

> And told us not to fuss, 

> 

> And he said to tell you, Mommy, 

> 

> He's watching over us." 

> 

> The mother knew without a doubt 

> 

> That what they spoke was true, 

> 

> For she recalled their dad's last words, 

> 

> "I will watch over you." 

> 

> The firemen's notes could not explain 

> 

> The twisted, mangled car, 

> 

> And how the three of them escaped 

> 

> Without a single scar. 

> 

> But on the cop's report was scribed, 

> 

 In print so very fine, An angel walked 



 the beat tonight on Highway 109.

NAS LYRICS

"I Can"

[Kids]
I know I can (I know I can) 
Be what I wanna be (be what I wanna be) 
If I work hard at it (If I work hard at it)
I'll be where I wanna be (I'll be where I wanna be)

[Nas]
Be, B-Boys and girls, listen up 
You can be anything in the world, in God we trust
An architect, doctor, maybe an actress 
But nothing comes easy it takes much practice
Like, I met a woman who's becoming a star
She was very beautiful, leaving people in awe
Singing songs, Lina Horn, but the younger version
Hung with the wrong person
Got her strung on that
Heroin, cocaine, sniffin up drugs all in her nose...
Coulda died, so young, now looks ugly and old
No fun cause now when she reaches for hugs people hold they breath
Cause she smells of corrosion and death 
Watch the company you keep and the crowd you bring
Cause they came to do drugs and you came to sing
So if you gonna be the best, I'ma tell you how,
Put your hands in the air, and take a vow

[Chorus - 2x (Nas and Kids)]
I know I can (I know I can) 
Be what I wanna be (be what I wanna be) 
If I work hard at it (If I work hard at it)
I'll be where I wanna be (I'll be where I wanna be)

[Nas]
Be, B-Boys and girls, listen again
This is for grown looking girls who's only ten
The ones who watch videos and do what they see
As cute as can be, up in the club with fake ID
Careful, 'fore you meet a man with HIV
You can host the TV like Oprah Winfrey 
Whatever you decide, be careful, some men be
Rapists, so act your age, don't pretend to be 
Older than you are, give yourself time to grow
You thinking he can give you wealth, but so
Young boys, you can use a lot of help, you know
You thinkin life's all about smokin weed and ice
You don't wanna be my age and can't read and write
Begging different women for a place to sleep at night
Smart boys turn to men and do whatever they wish
If you believe you can achieve, then say it like this

[Chorus]

[Nas]
Be, be, 'fore we came to this country 
We were kings and queens, never porch monkeys
There was empires in Africa called Kush 
Timbuktu, where every race came to get books
To learn from black teachers who taught Greeks and Romans
Asian Arabs and gave them gold when 
Gold was converted to money it all changed 
Money then became empowerment for Europeans
The Persian military invaded 
They heard about the gold, the teachings, and everything sacred
Africa was almost robbed naked
Slavery was money, so they began making slave ships 
Egypt was the place that Alexander the Great went 
He was so shocked at the mountains with black faces
Shot up they nose to impose what basically 
Still goes on today, you see? 
If the truth is told, the youth can grow 
Then learn to survive until they gain control
Nobody says you have to be gangstas, hoes
Read more learn more, change the globe
Ghetto children, do your thing
Hold your head up, little man, you're a king
Young Princess when you get your wedding ring
Your man is saying "She's my queen"

[Chorus]

Save the music y'all, save the music y'all
Save the music y'all, save the music y'all
Save the music

i got this joke from my friend jordans away message it is really funny  
  There was an American man that had an meeting in France. He met a woman and that night they had their own meeting. While they were where having sex, she was yelling, "TROU FAUX,TROU FAUX." He did not know what that meant, but assumed it to be some sort of praise. 
The next day, he went to play golf with the men he had the meeting with. One of them made a hole in one. He yelled, "TROU FAUX,TROU FAUX !" 

They looked at him and said, "what do you mean wrong hole?"

i had a really fun week so here it goes-
 
 monday- we left the house around 12:30 and got there at about 4, we set everything up and then just hung out and didnt do much, so that was kinda boring.

 tuesday-my dad and my sis went fishing and me and my mom went to the tanger outlets, i got two pairs of shorts and some really cute underwear at rue 21 and then went in to gap and got so pink body spary and lotion. and then went back to the camper and my dad and sis got home and then we went shopping for a kayak, but did get one cuz they were to expensive. and then we went back to the campground and went kayaking in a rental and then went swimming.

 weds- we went to BJ's and got my a cool looking orange and white kayak., and then we went to wally-world and then we went up to the place called castle in the sky and it was really pretty i thought it was neat. then we went back to the campground went kayaking in my new kayak and then went swimming again. 

 thurs-we wnt to the concord airport adn got a couple of drivers and their pit crew members autographs. like: david green, matt kensth, the head of nascar, the crew cheif, tire changer, and gas man of kasey kahnes pit crew. we were there from like 9 am-3:30 pm and then we went to the laconia airport and got some more autpgraphs from: martin truex jr., jeff green, greg biffle (and my dog got to play with his doggie), jamie mcmurray and his crew cheif, kevin harvick, and robby gordon. i tired to get dale earnhardt jr. but he keep driving away and i was really mad cuz he is my favorite. then we went back to the camper at about 8:30 pm. 

 friday-we went shopping at the track and then went to qualifying and martin truex jr. got dale jr. in thrid spot but he still had to start at the end. :( o well he did good. and then went to my cousins house for dinner and then went back to the camper. 

 sat- me and mom went shopping and i got a pug stuffed animal that really barks, lol, its so cute. and then went to walmart and bought four boxes of nascar tradeing cards and some of the race cars were there and i got pics of those. and then that night we went to play mini golf and that was it.

 sunday- we went to the race but it wasnt very exciting, the only wreck that was in front of us was martin truex jr. and my dad was makeing fun of me cuz truex jr. was driving dale jr. car for him and that is my favorite so my dad took a whole bunch of pics of the kinda wrecked car. so yea and then when the race was over we went back to the campground and packed everything up and went to bed.
 
 monday-woke up at 3:30 am and drove home (cuz my dad had to go to work) and then got home around 6:30 and i went straight to bed and then woke back up at 11. so yea i had so much fun over my little week of vaca. i saw so many hot guy though it was great.

yeah yesterday was stephens party and it was so much fun, we played foot ball out in the rain and jason was on my team (omg so hhhhhhhhhooooooooooottttttttttt!!!!!!!!) and we won all the games. it was great and then we went and played some video games yea me and jessie were great we keep crashing lol. and then we went and played more football after it just stormed and we keep slipping and falling, yeah some great times and then we went and watched anger management, and i got to sit next to jason and stephen. and yea we had so much fun. 

and today i finshed putting carpet upstairs yeah!! and we are getting ready to bring the rest of my funiture up there. and then finally my room will be done!!! yeah!!!

all next week i am going up to new hampshire for the race and to see family so i most likly wont be able to write for a while. so yeah when i get back i am hoping that i can have my pool party!! that would be great. so yea talk to ya'll later!!

today i had to go to Yale for my dad and i know i def. dont want to go to school there to much action on the streets. and we went to target and there was a really long line so my mom asked this really cute cashier if he was still open even though his light was off, and he said no but then he looked at me and was like ok you can come over here, and yeah he keep looking at me and he was def, HOTT yesterday i went and got my hair cut, it looks ok but it not really how i wanted it, o well cant change it now, i watched In America, that was a really good movie, and yea i think that is all i did yesterday, and today i was basiclly in the car al day so nothing exciting happened there. but, when we were leaving the post office, i saw jason and i was like mom follow that truck so we did and he went to stephens house and since we got a new car my mom was like o lets go and show stephen the new car, but only cuz jason was there and she was just being dumb, but yea that was pretty funny, well yea time to go and eat dinner and i have nothing else to say anyway.
